column1: States can receive a maximum of 100 points
CATEGORY 1:  KEEPING GUNS OUT OF THE HANDS OF DANGEROUS PEOPLE
BACKGROUND CHECKS TO STOP DANGEROUS PEOPLE FROM BUYING GUNS
Background Checks on All Gun Sales
column3: Require background checks for all unlicensed firearm sales

column1: Background Checks on All Handgun Sales
Background Checks on All Gun Show Sales
column3: Require background checks at gun shows only

column1: OTHER LAWS TO STOP DANGEROUS PEOPLE FROM BUYING AND CARRYING GUNS
Carry Laws That Give Law Enforcement Full Discretion
column3: Concealed carry permits granted on a discretionary basis

column1: Carry Laws That Deprive Law Enforcement of Full Discretion
Carry Laws That Allow Non-Residents From Any State to Obtain Permits by Mail (Must only be a U.S. Citizen, can get permit by mail, not need reciprocal agreement from issuing state)
No Permit or Background Check Required to Carry
Laws Allowing Law Enforcement to Conduct Thorough Screening For Purchase (Permits-All Firearms)
Laws Allowing Law Enforcement to Conduct Thorough Screening For Purchase (Permits-Handguns Only)
Fingerprints Recognized as Part of Screening
Block Dangerous People from Self-Assembled and 3D-Guns

column1: LAWS TO SECURE GUNS FROM DANGEROUS PEOPLE
Records of All Guns Purchased Provided to Law Enforcement so Owners Can Be Identified if They Become Prohibited

column1: Legal Tools for Family Members to Prevent Gun Violence (Gun Violence Restraining Order)
column3: Negligence-based or similar laws permitting penalties for firearm owners who fail to prevent child access

column1: CATEGORY 2:  STOPPING THE SUPPLY OF CRIME GUNS
LAWS AND POLICIES TO STOP BAD APPLE GUN DEALERS FROM SUPPLYING CRIMINALS WITH GUNS

column1: All Sales Videotaped to Catch Straw Purchasing and Gun Trafficking
Dealer Code of Conduct to Require Safe, Responsible Business Practices

column3: Require reporting of lost or stolen firearms

column1: Law Enforcement Inspections of Gun Dealers (mandatory)
Law Enforcement Inspections of Gun Dealers (allows)

CATEGORY 3:  MAKING OUR NATIONAL GUN VIOLENCE PROBLEM WORSE
Less than 1.0 gun deaths per 100,000 persons

Research on state gun laws from the Law Center to Prevent Gun Violence was the primary source used to determine the points allocated to states in this analysis. Visit: www.smartgunlaws.org.
